original: saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgatomhī’ti labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ;
analyzed: saṅghe avecca pasādena samannāgataḥ asmi iti labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: And whatever has been given with confidence to the Fortunate One, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha,

original: pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vedeti, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vedeti sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: When he is joyful, rapture arises. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, he feels bliss. And when he is blissful, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: ‘Yathodhi kho pana me cattaṁ vantaṁ muttaṁ pahīnaṁ paṭinissaṭṭhan’ti labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ;
analyzed: yathā udhi kho pana me cattam vantam muttam pahīnam paṭinissaṭṭhanti labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: ‘I have given up, renounced, let go, and abandoned my view of a self. I have no more doubts, uncertainties, or skepticism about whether this is good or that is bad. I have no more doubts, uncertainties, or skepticism about whether this is the teaching or that is not the teaching. I have no more doubts, uncertainties, or skepticism about whether this is the Teacher’s way or that is not the Teacher’s way.’ He gains inspiration in the meaning, gains inspiration in the Dhamma, gains great joy connected with the Dhamma.

original: pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vedeti, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vedeti sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: When he is joyful, rapture arises. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, he feels bliss. And when he is blissful, the mind becomes concentrated.🔽If a monk of such virtue, such qualities, and such wisdom eats almsfood consisting of choice hill rice along with various sauces and curries, it won’t be an obstacle for him.

original: Sa kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṁsīlo evaṁdhammo evaṁpañño sālīnañcepi piṇḍapātaṁ bhuñjati vicitakāḷakaṁ anekasūpaṁ anekabyañjanaṁ, nevassa taṁ hoti antarāyāya.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, vatthaṁ saṅkiliṭṭhaṁ malaggahitaṁ acchodakaṁ āgamma parisuddhaṁ hoti pariyodātaṁ, ukkāmukhaṁ vā panāgamma jātarūpaṁ parisuddhaṁ hoti pariyodātaṁ;
analyzed: sa kho saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu eva sīlaḥ eva dhammaḥ eva pañño sālīnam cepi piṇḍapātam bhuñjati vicita kāḷakam aneka sūpam aneka byañjana na iva assa tam hoti antarāyāya 🔽seyyathā api bhikkhave vattham saṅkiliṭṭham malaggahitam accha udakam āgamma parisuddham hoti pariyodātaḥ ukkā mukham vā pana āgamma jātarūpam parisuddham hoti pariyodātaḥ
translated: Just as a dirty piece of cloth, being devoid of color, will not properly take any dye,

original: evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṁsīlo evaṁdhammo evaṁpañño sālīnañcepi piṇḍapātaṁ bhuñjati vicitakāḷakaṁ anekasūpaṁ anekabyañjanaṁ, nevassa taṁ hoti antarāyāya.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhikkhave bhikkhu eva sīlaḥ eva dhammaḥ eva pañño sālīnam cepi piṇḍapātam bhuñjati vicita kāḷakam aneka sūpam aneka byañjana na iva assa tam hoti antarāyāya
translated: In the same way, when a bhikkhu has such virtue, such a Dhamma, such wisdom, such liberation, even if he eats rice and delicacies from the storeroom, it will not be an obstacle for him.

original: So mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,🔽tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena
analyzed: saḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam viharati tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam mettā sahagatena
translated: “He abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth;

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati;
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: karuṇā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: He abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with compassion…

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: with a mind imbued with appreciative joy…

original: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā dutiya tathā tatiya
translated: with a mind imbued with equanimity, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth;

original: tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with equanimity, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: He dwells with a mind filled with and overflowing with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: So ‘atthi idaṁ, atthi hīnaṁ, atthi paṇītaṁ, atthi imassa saññāgatassa uttari nissaraṇan’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: so atthi ida atthi hīna atthi paṇīta atthi imassa saññāgatassa uttari nissaraṇanti pajānāti
translated: He understands: ‘There is this,’ and he also understands: ‘This is far better.’

original: Tassa evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati.
analyzed: tassa evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccati bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccati avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccati
translated: When he knows and sees thus, his mind is liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ hoti.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam hoti
translated: When it is liberated there comes the knowledge: ‘It is liberated.’

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: He understands: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave:
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave
translated: This, bhikkhus, is called

original: ‘bhikkhu sināto antarena sinānenā’”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhu sinātaḥ antarena sinānena ati
translated: a bhikkhu who is inwardly pure, who has entered upon the way that is inwardly pure.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ avidūre nisinnaḥ hoti
translated: Now on that occasion the brahmin Sundarika Bharadvaja was sitting not far from the Blessed One.

original: Atha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then he said to the Blessed One:

original: “gacchati pana bhavaṁ gotamo bāhukaṁ nadiṁ sināyitun”ti?
analyzed: gacchati pana bhavam gotamaḥ bāhukam nadim sināyitum ti
translated: “Does Master Gotama go to the river Bhahaka to bathe?”

original: “Kiṁ, brāhmaṇa, bāhukāya nadiyā?
analyzed: ki brāhmaṇa bāhukāya nadiyā
translated: “What about the Bāhukā River, brahmin?

original: Kiṁ bāhukā nadī karissatī”ti?
analyzed: kim bāhukā nadī karissati iti
translated: What will the Bāhukā River do?”

original: “Lokkhasammatā hi, bho gotama, bāhukā nadī bahujanassa, puññasammatā hi, bho gotama, bāhukā nadī bahujanassa, bāhukāya pana nadiyā bahujano pāpakammaṁ kataṁ pavāhetī”ti.
analyzed: lokkha sammatā hi bho gotama bāhukā nadī bahu janassa puñña sammatā hi bho gotama bāhukā nadī bahu janassa bāhukāya pana nadiyā bahu janaḥ pāpa kammam katam pavāheti iti
translated: “Master Gotama, the Bāhukā River is considered by many to be a river that leads to purification and to heaven, and many wash away evil deeds in the Bāhukā River.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sundarikabhāradvājaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā sundarikabhāradvājam brāhmaṇam gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja in stanzas:

original: “Bāhukaṁ adhikakkañca,🔽gayaṁ sundarikaṁ mapi;
analyzed: bāhukam adhikakkam ca  gayam sundarikam m api
translated: “The Bāhukā, the Adhikakkā,🔽Gaya, and the Sundarikā,

original: Sarassatiṁ payāgañca,🔽atho bāhumatiṁ nadiṁ;
analyzed: sarassatim payāgam ca  atha u bāhumatim nadi
translated: The Sarassatī, the Payāga,🔽And the river Bāhumatī—

original: Niccampi bālo pakkhando,
analyzed: niccam pi bālaḥ pakkhandaḥ
translated: Even if a fool should bathe in them

original: kaṇhakammo na sujjhati.
analyzed: kaṇha kammaḥ na sujjhati
translated: His evil deed is not purified.

original: Kiṁ sundarikā karissati,
analyzed: kim sundarikā karissati
translated: What will the Sundarikā do?

original: Kiṁ payāgā kiṁ bāhukā nadī;🔽Veriṁ katakibbisaṁ naraṁ,
analyzed: kim payāgā kim bāhukā nadī  verim katakibbisam nara
translated: What will the Payāga or the Bāhukā River do?

original: Na hi naṁ sodhaye pāpakamminaṁ.🔽Suddhassa ve sadā phaggu,
analyzed: na hi nam sodhaye pāpa kammina  suddhassa ve sadā phaggu
translated: It cannot purify the evil deed🔽Of a man who has done an evil deed.🔽The pure one is always radiant;

original: Suddhassuposatho sadā;
analyzed: suddhaḥ su posathaḥ sadā
translated: The pure one always observes the Uposatha;

original: Suddhassa sucikammassa,
analyzed: suddhassa su ci kammassa
translated: The pure one of pure deeds

original: Sadā sampajjate vataṁ;
analyzed: sadā sampajjate vata
translated: Always succeeds in his purpose.

original: Idheva sināhi brāhmaṇa,
analyzed: idhā iva sināhi brāhmaṇa
translated: Here, brahmin, bathe,

original: Sabbabhūtesu karohi khemataṁ.
analyzed: sabba bhūtesu karohi khemata
translated: Extend safety to all beings.

original: Sace musā na bhaṇasi,
analyzed: sace musā na bhaṇasi
translated: If you don’t speak falsehood,🔽if you don’t harm living beings,

original: sace pāṇaṁ na hiṁsasi;🔽Sace adinnaṁ nādiyasi,
analyzed: sace pāṇam na hisasi  sace a dinnam na ādiyasi
translated: if you don’t take what’s not given,

original: saddahāno amaccharī;
analyzed: sat dahānaḥ amat śarī
translated: if you’re faithful and not stingy,

original: Kiṁ kāhasi gayaṁ gantvā,
analyzed: kim kā ahasi gayam gantvā
translated: what will you do by going to Gayā?

original: udapānopi te gayā”ti.
analyzed: te
translated: Even a well is your Gayā.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Sundarikabhāradvāja said to the Blessed One,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya—cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantīti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: in the same way has Master Gotama—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Labheyyāhaṁ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyya aham bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Alattha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.🔽Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā bhāradvājo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto🔽viharanto nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti,
analyzed: alattha kho sundarikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada  acira upasampannaḥ kho pana āyasmā bhāradvājaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitatto  viharantaḥ kula puttā sammad eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti
translated: The brahmin Sundarikabhāradvāja received the going forth in the presence of the Lord, he received the full ordination.🔽And soon, not long after his full ordination, dwelling solitary, ardent, and resolute,

original: tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosānam diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: the venerable Bhāradvāja, by realising for himself with direct knowledge, here and now entered upon and abided in that supreme goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: He directly knew: “Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.”

original: Aññataro kho panāyasmā bhāradvājo arahataṁ ahosīti.
analyzed: aññataraḥ kho pana ayasmai bhāradvājaḥ arahatam ahosi iti
translated: And the venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the perfected ones.

original: Vatthasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: vattha suttam niṭṭhitam sattama
translated: The seventh sutta in the Middle Length Sayings is finished.
